page.title: 19Housing summary.
page.content: {Alms houses}were built by the Wenlock family before 1915 to house "the poor,aged and infirm" of Escrick and Deighton.The Wenlock Trust which is a charitable organisation manages and maintains the alms houses.{Private {dwellings}are mainly detached with good sized gardens and built since 1957.They make up a sizeable proportion of the village.The aim of the Planning Authority is to keep East of the A19.Wenlock Drive was built in 1957,mostly of brick.The Glade, which includes 10 bungalows,was built in 1960 of stone with pantile roofs. Dower Chase was built in 1976. Planning permission has been given for a further 25 houses.{Large houses} include Escrick Park,now a girls' school,Dower House and Escrick Court - the former police station.None of these are now private dwellings.
